bill.title: Voting Rights, Incarcerated Persons
bill.description: Allows incarcerated persons who were Hawaii residents at the time of their arrest and who have no more than two years left before release from imprisonment, to vote by absentee ballot in Hawaii's elections. Effective 7/1/2050 (SD2)

referrals.name: Public Safety, Intergovernmental and Military Affairs

history.action: (S) Introduced.
(S) Passed First Reading.
(S) Referred to PSM, JGO.
(S) The committee(s) on PSM has scheduled a public hearing on 02-12-09 1:15pm in conference room 229.

(S) The committee(s) on PSM recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in PSM were as follows: 4 Aye(s): Espero, Bunda, Galuteria, Kidani; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 3 Excused: English, Gabbard, Hemmings.
(S) Reported from PSM (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 275) with recommendation of passage on Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referral to JGO.
(S) Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to JGO.
(S) The committee(s) on JGO will hold a public decision making on 03-06-09 11:00am in conference room 016.
(S) The committee on JGO has rescheduled its decision making from 03-06-09 11:00 AM to 03-06-09 9:30 AM in conference room 016.

(S) The committee(s) on JGO recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in JGO were as follows: 3 Aye(s): Senator(s) Taniguchi, Bunda, Nishihara; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 1 No(es): Senator(s) Slom; and 2 Excused: Senator(s) Takamine, Gabbard.
(S) Reported from JGO (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 776) with recommendation of passage on Third Reading, as amended (SD 2).
(S) 48 Hrs. Notice 03-10-09.

(S) Report adopted; Passed Third Reading, as amended (SD 2). Ayes, 18; Aye(s) with reservations: none . Noes, 7 (Senator(s) Gabbard, Green, Hemmings, Kim, Nishihara, Slom, Tsutsui). Excused, 0 (none). Transmitted to House.
(H) Received from Senate (Sen. Com. No. 211) in amended form (SD 2).
(H) Pass First Reading
(H) Referred to PBS, JUD, FIN, referral sheet 27
(H) Bill scheduled to be heard by PBS on Thursday, 03-19-09 8:30 AM in House conference room 309.

(H) The committees on PBS recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 7 Ayes: Representative(s) Hanohano, Aquino, Saiki, Souki, Yamashita; Ayes with reservations: Representative(s) Awana, Rhoads; 1 Noes: Representative(s) M. Lee; and 4 Excused: Representative(s) Keith-Agaran, Nakashima, Takumi, Pine.
(H) Reported from PBS (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 1055), recommending passage on Second Reading and referral to JUD.
(H) Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on JUD with Representative(s) Ching, Finnegan, Pine voting no (3) and Representative(s) Chang, McKelvey, Morita, Takai, Thielen excused (5).
Carried over to 2010 Regular Session.
